needed.description: The Perl herd is looking for experienced candidates to help Perl bug solving.
There are a larger number of bugs related to network fileing systems that need solving.
To get Gentoo on to ARM CPUs we need developers to undertake package testing, patching and general bug solving.
To get Gentoo working on uClibc systems we need people to help with uClibc debugging, toolchains, developing tools, and generally architecture testing and patching.
To get Gentoo on to S390 CPUs we need developers to undertake package testing, patching and general bug solving.
To get Gentoo on to 64 bit PPC CPUs we need developers to undertake package testing, patching and general bug solving.
The Gentoo Security Team is seeking GLSA Coordinators to help with open security bugs that need solving.
To get Gentoo's large number of sound applications debugged and tested more developers are needed.
To get Gentoo's large number of Video and DVD applications debugged and testinged more developers are needed.
To get Gentoo's Web Application framework working with a number of different packages more developers are needed.
To further develop and support Voice over IP applications more developers are wanted.
There are a large number of bugs related to GCC, binutils and glibc that need to be solved.
Communication, fax, and related packages need a hand with maintenance.
The Java team is in desperate need of new developers to assist in maintaining Java ebuilds.
The UTF-8 team is looking to expand. We currently have only one developer on the team. The goal is to create a completely unicode-enabled Gentoo system.
The Alpha team is looking for developers with the ability to maintain (bug-fix, test) packages for the Alpha hardware platform. Ideally these developers have access to, or own, Alpha boxes.
The BSD team is looking for developers who have experience with both BSD and with GNU/Linux to help port Gentoo to the FreeBSD platform. The immediate focus is to have a working BSD baselayout.

The X11 team needs help with the core X.org implementation. In particular, we need people comfortable with the C language and with diving deep into X. As of 17 April 2005, more than 200 open bugs need fixing.
More developers are required to maintain network monitoring tools.
A general bug wrangler is required to assist in the bug solving and maintenance of the GnuPG and related cryptographic packages as a member of the crypto herd.

A research position exists with the crypto herd to develop Gentoo's ability to use a TCG (formally Trusted Computing Platform Alliance - TCPA) architecture to provide a trusted platform. Options range from adding support into GRUB, GnuPG, and Apache and other packages that use (or could use) crypto keys that require secrecy. You will be expected to write clear documentation on your development that comes to a useable product. A good understanding of TPM and computer security is expected.

Gentoo currently has a severe lack of people to maintain OpenLDAP and related packages (see bug #69252). People knowledgeable in LDAP both in its normal usage as a network-accessible directory and in it's more arcane use as an alternative to NIS are desperately sought.
The wxwindows herd needs developer(s) to help with package testing and maintenance.
The AMD64 team is looking for developers with the ability to maintain (bug-fix, test) packages for the EM64T hardware platform. These developers have access to or own Xeon boxes.

A research position exists within the crypto herd to develop SmartCard applications. You will be required to investigate and determine applications that can benefit from the integration of SmartCard capability, carry out the integration, and write approprate documentation. You will also be responsible for the bug solving and upkeep of SmartCard applications.
The mobile herd needs a new maintainer for the GPS related ebuilds currently in portage - there's also a quite a few enhancement requests in bugzilla for GPS related ebuilds.

The Gentoo/AMD64 team is looking for documentation developers to assist with revamping and updating AMD64 documentation. Prospective candidates should have good language skills and be familiar with XML.

The net-mail team is looking for someone experienced with the sendmail MTA, who could help maintain, or eventually take over the maintainership of sendmail and related packages. The number of sendmail-related bugs (i.e. milter feature of ClamAV) in bugzilla is growing and we need help.
The OSX team is in desparate need of developers who have working knowledge of both Mac OS X and GNU/Linux to help maintain, bug-fix, and test packages for the Gentoo for Mac OS X Project.
